grading.policies: Late assignments are not accepted unless true and documented emergency is explained.

assignments.description: Weekly homework assignments that must be completed by the due date.
Closed-book quizzes may be given in class and will be graded.
Open book quizzes will also be given occasionally via Canvas.
Major project consisting of a mix of individual and group assignments.

policies.attendance: Attendance will be taken and counted towards final grade.
policies.late_work: Late assignments are not accepted unless true and documented emergency is explained.
policies.academic_integrity: Graduate students are bound by the Graduate Student Code of Academic Integrity.

_metadata.course_description: Requirements engineering is one of the least understood and hardest phases in the development of software products.
learning_outcomes: Understand appropriate methods to elicit requirements from stakeholders
Know how to distinguish and describe functional and non-functional requirements in formal and non-formal notations
Understand how software requirements fit into the software lifecycle and influences other sub-processes.
Learn how to distinguish good requirements from bad requirements
Learn how to write and evaluate unambiguous requirements.
prerequisites: Some familiarity with software development is expected for this course.
